intro: Phacelia nevadensis, commonly known as Sierra phacelia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and rocky slopes. It has hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves, and it blooms from late spring to early summer. Sierra phacelia is often used in native plant gardens due to its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
